thread.title: Sir Alex Ferguson return confirmed: Carrick reveals Fergie is set for management comeback
thread.title_full: Sir Alex Ferguson return confirmed: Carrick reveals Fergie is set for management comeback

title: Sir Alex Ferguson return confirmed: Carrick reveals Fergie is set for management comeback
text:
Sir Alex Ferguson return confirmed: Carrick reveals Fergie is set for management comeback MICHAEL CARRICK has announced that Sir Alex Ferguson will be manager for his Manchester United testimonial. / Published 20th March 2017 Honoured to announce that The Boss will be manager at my testimonial in partnership with @_MCFoundation & @ManUtd . Will be a special day. pic.twitter.com/mDwcb4nTpA — Michael Carrick (@carras16) March 20, 2017 
The Red Devils midfielder will be honoured for his service to the club on Sunday, June 4. 
A United 2008 XI will take on a Carrick All Star XI at Old Trafford with kick-off at 4pm. 
And Carrick was delighted to announce that he has convinced Fergie to return to the dugout for the clash. 
GETTY Michael Carrick has announced Sir Alex Ferguson will manage his Man United testimonial Michael Carrick’s All Star XI: Possible line-up Sunday, 5th March 2017 MICHAEL CARRICK’s testimonial will feature an all-star XI taking on Manchester United’s 2008 Champions League winners, but who will play? 1 / 13 GETTY GK: David De Gea - The current United stopper is brilliant and the fans would love him to take part “” 
He said: "There's not much introduction really for this man. I'm honoured that he's going to come back and be part of the game. 
"He's probably the sole reason I came to this club, he brought me here, he signed me. 
"I can't thank him enough, he had a huge influence on my career, I learned so much from him. 
"He's the man that probably taught me how to win. Here's our manager Sir Alex Ferguson. The Boss." 
GETTY Michael Carrick moved to Man United in 2006 
More to follow
